summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 20-22, 2020, between FBI personnel and DOJ/CRT staff coordinating the distribution of meeting invitations and RSVP questionnaires to victims of Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss document clearance, logistics for sending individualized packets, and scheduling a call.

events.title: Scheduled Coordination Call
events.description: A call is scheduled for 2:30-3:30 PM to discuss victim outreach and logistics for sending individualized packets.

events.title: Document Preparation and Clearance
events.description: FBI and DOJ/CRT staff exchange and revise a meeting invitation letter and RSVP questionnaire for Epstein victims, going through a clearance process.

keyFacts: The FBI Victim Services Division was actively coordinating victim outreach related to the Epstein case in October 2020.
Individualized packets for victims were being created at FBI HQ with plans to Fed-Ex them to the Miami Field Office.
Documents required clearance, including review by OPA (Office of Public Affairs), due to potential public disclosure.
The communication shows ongoing inter-agency coordination (FBI, DOJ/CRT) for victim engagement years after Epstein's death.
